record.title: ORDERS FOR MONDAY, APRIL 21, 2008
record.narrative:
ORDERS FOR MONDAY, APRIL 21, 2008 -- (Senate - April 18, 2008)

[Page: S3175]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that when the Senate completes its business today, it stand adjourned until 3 p.m., Monday, April 21; that following the prayer and pledge, the Journal of proceedings be approved to date, the morning hour be deemed expired, the time for the two leaders be reserved for their use later in the day, and there then be a period of morning business with Senators permitted to speak for up to 10 minutes each. I further ask that the Record remain open until 12 noon today, for the purpose of introducing bills, resolutions, cosponsors, and statements.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
